page.title: 06Hosiery Industry-Shepshed
page.content: The name{Shepshed}means{"hill where {sheep graze".}The sheep produced wool which the villagers used to knit {stockings.}At first they were made by hand, but in 1589 a{knitting frame was invented. They did not have factories in those days, so each house had a{workshop}to put the frame in. We can still see some of these today in people's gardens. The whole family would have had to work, and the pay was very poor. By the nineteenth century{hosiery factories}were being built. Gradually the frames developed, becoming better and faster.{Man-made {fibres}led to a fall in demand for hose, but the Shepshed factories were adapted to make other knitwear. Hosiery is still important to Shepshed today, with Mansfield, Charterhouse and many other smaller firms.
